website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for SSD-like performance at just a fraction of the cost, the Seagate Laptop Thin SSHD offers some gratification.
pros: The Seagate Laptop Thin SSHD offers noticeably faster boot time and better overall performance than regular hard drives at a much lower cost than solid-state drives
cons: The Seagate Laptop Thin SSHD's data transfer speed is slow
It comes with just 8GB of flash memory and spins at only 5,400rpm

customer_reviews.title: Amazon.com lied about 5-year warranty
customer_reviews.text: The product page for this drive here says it's 5-years. I even had confirmed with Seagate before buying it.  Well three years later the drive is making clicking noises, and it turns about both Amazon and Seagate lied about the warranty. It's actually 2-years. Corporate fraud and fascism. There's no other way to describe it. Can we just go back to the typewriter era, please, and bring back retail bookstores in our neighborhoods. Thank you for listening. Dot com, dot boom, dot bust...First it was the railroad barons, then the oil barons, the automotive barons, and now the technology and dot com barons. Let's pray for a baron-less world....
customer_reviews.author: K. Afsar

customer_reviews.title: The perfect choice if SSD is too much $$$$
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this 2 of these total, the first was for my original PS4. This review is for the one I just purchased for my new PS4 Slim. Works exactly as the old one, and I trust this model more than those new ones. You can go read the reviews yourself and make and informed decision, but I personally would take these every time IMO. I notice the SSD aspects of it start to kick in once I've played a few days with a game. Boot times decrease pretty decently, among other expected performance boosts. I love these things, hope they innovate more in the future. I cant afford a 3TB SSD, but I CAN afford one of these babies.
customer_reviews.author: Halcyon_Days

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of box. So was the replacement
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. I followed all of the instructions to install to my PS4, and it seemed to work fine. Except it considers every disc-based game to have corrupted data. I followed all instructions to troubleshoot the problem, and after no success and countless reinstallations, I installed the old hard drive into my PS4 and found that everything works fine. I will be returning the hard drive for a replacement, which hopefully works better since this product has good reviews as a PS4 hard drive. UPDATE: The replacement came and it has the same issue. Seagate Support has told me that "it should be working" and assured me I followed the correct steps for installation.
customer_reviews.author: shweenz

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to replace a 500GB mechanical drive in a Playstation 3. The installation was easy (check the web for step by step how to) and the drive is working very well. While my Playstation cannot do the improved read/write capabilities justice, the system runs cooler, quieter and I have installed 26 games on the drive using roughly a third of it's storage capabilities. All in all, I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Works in early 2011 macbook pro, but is thinner than stock hd
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace hard drive in early 2011 macbook pro. It is thinner than the original hard drive so you will either need a spacer to put between the hard drive and the bottom cover or just be aware it will move around a little. Works perfectly, very happy with performance.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Weiland

customer_reviews.title: Much needed performance improvement
customer_reviews.text: A much needed improvement over my old HDD. I saw about a minute worth of time in improvement on restarts and about 20 or 30 seconds on cold start ups. I think it is well worth the little extra for the 32GB vs 8GB NAND, for the ability to load everything I am working on in the on board flash memory. Makes working with certain programs much smoother and quicker in general. Not saying that a SSHD is a SSD, but for someone who is looking for a noticeable improvement over a HDD in daily tasks, and who is on a tight budget, this is an excellent option. One that I recommend completely.
customer_reviews.author: Ex Machina

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this hard drive just after Christmas for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hard drive just after Christmas for a computer used only to browse the internet SAFELY. It is now rearing May and I have received the Blue Screen of DEATH! I have tried to fix the issue with updates and such, to no avail. There is literally nothing but a few gigs of music stored on this drive and has been used a handful of times. I am very dissatisfied with the quality of this purchase, as now I have to purchase another hard drive and have someone install the operating system, again.
customer_reviews.author: Corrie Walters

customer_reviews.title: High performance, Low Cost for an older laptop
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these Seagate Hard Drives in my 2012 Macbook Pro after taking the DVD drive out of it. Performance is great, especially when editing and exporting pictures from Lightroom CC or when exporting and editing videos in Adobe Premiere Pro CC. Every now and then I'll also play videogames from steam like Team Fortress and Half Life and these harddrives work way better than the standard 5400RPM drive that was initially installed in my laptop. A year of use, and these drives are still going strong. I'd definitely recommend these to anyone out there looking for a harddrive upgrade to an older laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Miraflor

customer_reviews.title: Segate 1 TB Laptop Gaming SSHD
customer_reviews.text: I installed the New Segate ST1000LM014-1EJ164 Solid Dtate Hybrid drive in my HP 8200 Elite Ultra Slim Desktop computer which apparently uses a laptop motherboard. I have had extremely good luck with my Segate drives through the years with several with more than 7.5 years of run time registered on them. This drive appears to be doing very well at present. It is faster than the Samsung drive it replaced that was in the computer when I received it. It had about 5.5 years of runtime on it when it failed. I do not do gaming so can not provide a reasonable estimate on it's gaming capability.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Last Year;s Model Running Very Well
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is "last year's model," or something like that, it still performs really well. I installed this drive in a Lenovo T510 running Windows 1 Pro and it brought the laptop up to its full potential. It cut my uptime almost in half. So far, this has been a great hybrid drive. You get many of the great features of a SSD without the SSD price. I may be buying a few more of these very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W

customer_reviews.title: 2 Failed HD so far
customer_reviews.text: I received it November 28 it has been 7 days and the drive has now failed. UPDATE: I received the replacement for the prior faulty HD and again another failed HD. Apple once again ran their diagnostics and the results were faild HD. I have a regular 1TB HD and that one does not fail however when it comes to This SSHD it fails. I am now waiting the 3rd and hopefully final replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Yadira Corchado

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended upgrade to your PS4
customer_reviews.text: Like many people, I got this to replace the stock hard drive that came with the PS4. It was super easy to install, and it's great having the extra space since I now purchase all of my games digitally. System boot time and load times are also a bit faster, especially in games that take forever to load like Bloodborne, but it's not as big an improvement as going from, say, an HDD to an SSD on a PC. Also, get a USB 2.5 hard drive enclosure (I got one off of Amazon made by Inatech which works great) for your old PS4 hard drive and you now have a small 500 GB external hard drive, which is handy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: SSHD worked as advertised out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: This drive worked as expected out of the box. It is a genuine drive when I checked the serial number on verify.seagate.com . The drive is very responsive and works with my Apricorn SATA Wire 3 adapter. Windows 10 automatically detects the drive and downloaded the appropiate driver for the SATA wire adapter. Used this drive once it was properly formatted to replace the internal HDD of my Xbox One. Side note: The various Seagate applications are very crappy and just look plain ugly. They don't put much effort into software development.
customer_reviews.author: thefilmguy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent SSHD! Had 3 months no problems! Loading speed is faster than regular HDD! Recieved before expected date! Used on PS4!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Nethercutt

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my old Dell Latitude D630!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the old 90GB drive in my Dell D630 with this one. Tried 2 SSD drives, but the firmware would not recognize them. I put this one in and it was immediately recognized. I installed OPENsuse Leap 15,0 back on it and it screams again! Good investment if you have an older laptop that you want to refurbish and repurpose!
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW

customer_reviews.title: sounds like R2D2 is trying to escape my laptop
customer_reviews.text: Horrible drive. I tried about a year ago to upgrade to windows 10 and since then which kept crashing now gives me constant freezing for a second followed by a beep. Ran the Seatools on their website and shows the drive is fine, but it's obviously not. I was thinking of getting another sshd but since my main drive is an ssd I think a 7200 rpm will be a better long term solution. Not a fan of these awful drives. (Been in the IT business for over 15 years) I depend on a fast durable drive to get my work done and this has not been either.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Mike

customer_reviews.title: The PS4 now has double the nominal capacity.
customer_reviews.text: The alteration was straightforward. I did the swap, software upgrade and initialization in one go. I wanted to spare myself the hassle of data transfers and to solve the capacity problem by upgrading before ever playing anything on it.
customer_reviews.author: rmrg

customer_reviews.title: Much improved XBox One load times!
customer_reviews.text: I paired this Seagate 1TB SSHD (ST1000LM014) with the Unlike some, I've had no problems with the external drive powering down with the XB1 in "instant-on" sleep mode with auto updates enabled. Maybe that issue has been fixed. Here are some benchmarks of the internal XB1 HDD vs. SSHD. Note: Games were loaded twice to allow for caching. GTAV SP = 106s --> 61s with markedly fewer texture pop-ins. MGSV:TPP = 102s --> 79s Forza6 Menu 48s --> 30s, Monza Short Circuit 23.5s --> 17s
customer_reviews.author: J. Frith

customer_reviews.title: Ideal alternative to the standard Mac Mini 1Tb drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Mac Mini 2014 2.6 Ghz I5 computer a few months ago. It comes with a 1Tb 5400 rpm standard laptop drive. The Mac Mini performed terrible. I really disliked it, as it was slow to boot up and slow running my applications. I brought the SSHD drive, installed it and now the mac mini "flies". Boot up time is twice as fast and applications take about 2 seconds to open. Even my large photo database only takes approx. 5 seconds to load thousands of photos. This drive is simply fantastic for the price. Needless to say, I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: maitai

customer_reviews.title: Huge performance boost on my ps4!
customer_reviews.text: Like many others on here, I bought this to replace the hdd that came installed in my ps4. This fit perfectly. I had no problems whatsoever installing the ps4 firmware onto it. The whole process of installing this took about 15 minutes, from unboxing to turning on my ps4 with the new faster, and bigger hdd. I have had this hard drive installed for a little over a month now and have noticed a BIG difference in speed and performance! I recommend to anybody wanting an upgrade for their ps4 to purchase this!
customer_reviews.author: Roger T.

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade hard drive for PS4. Greatly improves system speed.
customer_reviews.text: Slapped this baby in my PS4 and ding dolly by golly my PS4 runs like a champ. I am very impressed with the speeds at which games download and start and just the overall speed of any activities performed on the PS4. I really recommend this Seagate Hybrid SSHD if you wanna upgrade your PS4's stock hard drive. Unless you want a 2TB or something (I kinda did but wouldve like a 2TB Hybrid SSHD w/ 16 flash) but this works great
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great for mid-2010 Mac Book Pro 13"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the 500GB hard drive that came with my mid-2010 Mac Book Pro 13". The original always had some type of issue that made it process certain activities longer. It would always get stuck "thinking". I dealt with it until I'd filled the drive to capacity. That's when I found this and purchased based on the reviews. Replacing the drive was straight forward and easy. Time Machine is awesome. All of my data and apps are intact without issues. It's been exactly a week and my Mac is like NEW. Seriously. It's faster and no longer hangs on commands/activity. If you need to upgrade your hard drive this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: SparksReview

customer_reviews.title: MacBook Pro boot time cut in half!
customer_reviews.text: I have a late 2011 13" MacBook Pro running macOS Sierra that was just dreadfully slow. The computer was getting to the point it was almost unuseable. To get an SSD near the same coacity as the original 500GB HDD was just not affordable. My cousin who is in IT recommended one of these SSHD Hybrid Drives and to double my storage for the price and gain some speed just made sense! My MacBook is MUCH snappier and boot time was cut to half or more! Highly recommend if you need storage and speed on a budget!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helped system performance
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I am enjoying faster boot times and system performance without having to spend a lot more for a full SSD. It can't touch an SSD for speed but if you want higher capacity and improved performance over a standard HDD at a much lower cost this is a great compromise. Just know that you won't see this improved performance right away, it takes a little time to learn how you use your system. I noticed a big difference after about 5 reboots.
customer_reviews.author: PC Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap failed after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap failed after 7 months... Replacing PCB board to see if that'll resolve issue. Was extremely hot when I noticed it was disconnecting from machine randomly... Put fan on it and started recovering data and it lasted several hours before locking up/crashing, did this multiple times, salvaging about 1/3 of my data... hoping it's just a bad PCB so will report back once I know more. Still a CRAPPY drive, every seagate I've ever owned fails and they always fail in my client computers (I'm in IT for a living). If it wasn't for Seagate, I probably wouuldn't be in the data backup/recovery business.
customer_reviews.author: CRAZY4TECH

customer_reviews.title: Slower than my cable modem.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this to work. I have been very satisfied with refurbished products before as there is usually little or no difference between a refurb and brand new. But this drive did not work well at all. Installed easily, formatted. flawlessly, booted up my MacBook readily. Then virtually crawled. Black Magic Disk Speed Test shows it is running at a significantly slower data transfer rate than my cable modem. I suppose someone could work with it, but I can't.
customer_reviews.author: M Vire

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: If I knew then what I know now I would've never purchased this and just went with a Western Digital Blue SSD 500Gb or 1Tb, instead of this SSHD. SSD vs SSHD = SSD is always better. Better clock timers to get projects done and especially for gaming. SSHD is best for your grandmother that only checks her emails that took her 2 years to figure out how to send one!
customer_reviews.author: R.S.

customer_reviews.title: Got a used hard drive when I ordered a new one
customer_reviews.text: The screws are not flushed with the body. So it pushes a bit on the cover. The hard drive itself looks fine and should work fine since I've bought many before but this hard drive that I got IS USED. THERE'S 200 GIGABYTES OF DATA ALREADY USED. I ordered a new one but got a used one and need it for a client tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Nx u

customer_reviews.title: YMMV but mine not so good.
customer_reviews.text: Over the last 2 - 3 years I have ordered 5 of these drives with the Oyen enclosure - I lost my 3rd one today. Not happy. Update: 12/19/2017 I have now had 3 drives fail. I had a 4th one fail, but it did it right after purchase and was replaced by Seagate. Don't know if it was the drive or the enclosure. I had them all loaded in one of these:  I was real happy when they worked.
customer_reviews.author: Skip, W5UTWTop Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: For a Hybrid SSD/Spinning disk this thing is pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased this to increase the storage space and to improve the performance of my old laptop. It was taking about 1.5 minutes to boot up. With this disk installed, it takes about 40 seconds, and has sped up my laptop a great deal. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I am not disappointed. The drive was very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This revitalized my wife's laptop!! I recently installed Windows 10 and everything seemed sluggish and slow. Nothing worked properly. After reviewing performance and realizing the hard drive was working to the max, I decided it was time for an upgrade. I purchased this due to the other shining reviews and the promise of much faster speeds. I am not disappointed. The drive was very easy to install, and the computer is running better than it ever has. If you want a snappy computer, this is the drive you need to get. You don't have to sacrifice space for performance!
customer_reviews.author: Swantzify

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade if you are replacing a conventional hard drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a good hard drive. It is a worthwhile improvement over the conventional 300GB 5400 rpm hard drive I had previously on this laptop (an aging Dell D620). It is definitely faster. I do have a second D620 with a true 300GB SSD and the true SSD is quite a bit faster than this (and perfectly quiet), but for the price, this hard drive is worth it. The operation of the SSD partition is totally transparent. I installed Windows 7 on it without a hitch, and then I converter to Windows 10 just before the deadline for the free upgrade and that also went very well. It has been about 2 months now and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Didier

customer_reviews.title: Great drive so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my standard laptop hard drive because I needed more space. I found it fairly easy to change and I was able to transfer an image of my old hard drive to this one. I don't know if it's terribly much faster than my old hard drive although Windows 10 seems to boot quite quickly. I haven't had any issues with the drive and I like having the extra space. It remains to be seen how reliable it will be over the long run but so far I am very happy with this hard drive and can recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Happy with this purchase--and it really FLIES!
customer_reviews.text: This little drive absolutely flies! I was skeptical, but now I am a believer. I treated this just like a standard drive, and divided it up into three separate partitions. I then used a tool to 'clone' partitions from three separate drives onto this one, 1TB drive. Now I use it to boot up under three separate Operating Systems and wow, does this drive FLY!! Especially if you boot a few times in a row, you can tell from the performance increase that it is running from SSD... basically what it already has loaded in cache, so it makes it was faster. Love this drive. For the price, what a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Costs a few dollars more than a standard drive; almost as fast at booting as an SSD.
customer_reviews.text: Boots almost as fast as an SSD, but costs almost the same as a spinning drive. Not worth buying standard drives any more. Have used several of these over the years and they work great. Unfortunately, Seagate thinks since it seeks so quickly, 5400RPMs is fine. I have a 5400RPM and a 7200RPM SSHD and I can absolutely confirm the 7200 is significantly faster. Still, this works very well. Don't believe ALL the hype: an SSD will function faster in use, but this is significantly cheaper and still quick enough that, to me, it's not worth the price difference to get an SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Don Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade for PS4
customer_reviews.text: great upgrade for my PS4. pretty much plug and play after setting it up for PS4 use. noticeable speed gains vs the stock 5400 rpm drive that the ps4 came with. i tried a 1tb samsung 850 evo SSD on my ps4. yes it's faster than this hybrid drive, but very slightly. it also costs about $350~$400 ffor a 1tb SSD. i coulnd't justify the cost of the SSD considering the speed differencial between hybrid and SSD. so i'm using ssd on my computer instead and slapped this hybrid drive. it's the best investment i made for my PS4. just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kim

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working very well! It's much faster than my OEM HDD. Installed in a late 2008 MacBook Pro 15.4 You must buy screws to keep it in your Mac, but I already had those. A great upgrade, because now my Mac has been revived! PowerPoint used to be a long drawn out process of opening, force closing, managing other programs, etc. Now, I just click it and it just does what it's supposed to. Major speed upgrade for sure. I bought mine as "used" from Amazon for a great deal at somewhere around $45. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymousreviewer

customer_reviews.title: My Wife's Computer is Better than New...
customer_reviews.text: My wife's laptop is about a year old and has been excruciatingly slow for months. I'm a very experienced computer user and I've worked on several for many years. Changing the hard drive was my last ditch effort to make my wife laptop more useable. Since installing this hard drive, I have seen noticeable improvement it's performance. I would recommend this product. In case your wondering: I cloned the original hard drive onto this one and installed it. It was simple and only required a few hours to complete the entire process. Most of the time was spent waiting on the cloning process to complete.
customer_reviews.author: CAREY B

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Installed with no problems, easy install of OS X using Apple's Internet Recovery. Love the extra space on my early 2011 edition Macbook Pro. Just be aware, if you look closely at the original, there are two little pegs that help keep the old HD stable and in place which this drive doesn't have. It's not really a big deal since most people don't violently shake their laptops while running (I hope). But just something to be aware of if you hear the drive moving around slightly every once in a while. Good price for such a quiet and fast hard drive, my computer feels like new again!
customer_reviews.author: JCEB

customer_reviews.title: Good product except for one thing ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product except for one thing that I want to everybody know. It makes high pitch sound when in idle status. I found somebody asked about this on the Q&A section and people answered that theirs don't make any sound. I thought I got a defective one, so returned it and have another one sent to me. Now, the new one makes the exact same sound which now I have to think that it is normal. Something everybody should consider If you're buying it for a second storage disk on a laptop that's is very silent.
customer_reviews.author: Won

customer_reviews.title: Gave new life to an old Acer 7551, seriously outperforms the OEM drive, saves lots of time with re/booting.
customer_reviews.text: Was able to accurately clone smaller and much slower OEM drive with multiple partitions without any hassle. Used the remaining space on the drive to install UbuntuStudio 15.04 (Linux). Both Windows 7 Pro and UbuntuStudio boot so much faster now, with Windows loading in under 30 seconds, and UbuntuStudio in about 2 seconds. I simply can't ask for better than that. Under Windows, my flight simulators run somewhat better (very hard drive intensive with all the scenery and aircraft files, ACARS, FMC's, weather apps, etc), I know it would be faster still if not for the GPU (can't change those in laptops, unfortunately).
customer_reviews.author: D. Lipsitz

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade for Mac Mini 2009
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in a 2009 Mac Mini which I'm using as a Plex Media server. The hard drive is very fast, and the difference over the OEM 5400 rpm drive was noticeable immediately. The hard drive swap is rated as "difficult" to do yourself, but the only challenging part was getting the case open. I'd recommend a good putty knife to attempt this. Overall the drive runs great, there's no bad sectors so far, and doesn't make a lot of noise. It's quite fast, and definitely worth the price. I'll probably get another 4 years out of this Mac Mini yet. I'd highly recommend for any laptop grade hard drive swaps, especially if it's 5400 rpm.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality long lasting Solid State Hybrid HDD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Solid State Hybrid drive to replace the old hard drive on my laptop that crashed. I've had it for over a year and a half now and it's still going strong. It runs flawlessly and I rarely ever experience any issues. If you're needing a new internal drive for your laptop and don't want to pay an arm and a leg then this is the perfect one. I would definitely buy this one again but I might step up to the 2TB capacity this time
customer_reviews.author: Lance A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, affordable way to upgrade your laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I watched a tutorial on CNET.com for how to upgrade your hard drive to something larger, and after research I found that the combination of hard drive and the faster SD was the perfect price point for me. My laptop starts up faster, and I’ve had no problems for all the months since I’ve upgraded. I used a dock to copy my hard drive, then unscrewed my macbook and took out the original apple hard drive. The only thing I wonder about it whether I picked the right size- the hard drive seems to have some wiggle room inside the body of my computer. I recommend Seagate- they make great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: the best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: I really love this. I have a 13" 2012 Macbook Pro that originally came with 128 GB. Now I'm what you call... excessive. I hoard a lot of files, mainly audiobooks and mobi files, and I knew that that wasn't going to cut it. This, along with the, has helped my computer to run faster and better. I recommend this. It's the best of both worlds; it has great storage with the speed of an SSD drive (or at least close to it). Keep in mind that I'm not a techie in any sense of the word. I'm a casual user.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Fast, large capacity for upgrading older laptops/notebooks...at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Brought new life to my old Dell Laptop - faster start-ups, faster network performance and quiet! I partitioned this drive to first double the C:\drive space, then added a D:\archive partition for backing up files, programs, data and things that might be necessary to recover my OS install. I also use an external SATA drive for that purpose using a Backup program. This is really a fine value without the high cost of a pure SSD, and because it is a hybrid drive, one gets the benefits of larger storage capacity and fast data performance, too!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kirbo

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade drive for most laptops, not only for gaming but for business use also.
customer_reviews.text: Has worked well so far. Have heard other have had warranty issues with Seagate bare drives that was not the case with this one, got it registered the day it arrived. Has been much more responsive than the smaller standard Toshiba drive that came with this laptop workstation. If you are upgrading to a larger drive on a laptop this is a good choice paired with a USB 3.0 to SATA III HD adapter cable.
customer_reviews.author: EC320

customer_reviews.title: Installed in my PS4
customer_reviews.text: I installed this into a PS4. Super easy to do, didn't have to format it or anything. Speeds are noticeably better in games that traditionally have long load times or have to hit the hard drive often. Planetside 2, Witcher, DAI all have noticeable load speed improvements. In addition, I notice significantly less pop in on Planetside as well as respawning and the map pulling up instantly. Little quality of life things that do give you a real advantage in game. You don't have to waste your money on a SSD, this works 97% as well for the PS4. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDude

customer_reviews.title: DRIVES ARE USED, NOT NEW
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these. 1st drive has over 11,000 hours already on it, have not yet checked second drive for age, unit was used with a network logon on it. SO FAR, 1st drive has performed to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: TheTimeRider

customer_reviews.title: Seagate is not a good choice
customer_reviews.text: After about 1.5 years, the drive is starting to fail, clicking sounds, would not boot my laptop after 4 attempts, then I was able to boot and and test it. Short DST - FAIL NAND is 8 and not 32GB
customer_reviews.author: Abatar

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this SSD. I replaced the 1 Terabyte drive with this Seagate drive, installed Windows 10 and turned it on. OMG it took about seven seconds for it to boot up. I was hoping it would increase battery life but that still appears to be the same as it was with the mechanical drive. The one caveat is that for now I need to carry around a couple of external drives to store my info but again the speed increase is well worth the inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I should have spent the extra $$ for a 100% solid state drive!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased May 21st, after installing it... 69 days later - on August 2, It completely crashed -- cannot reboot system, access disk utility and still get the white screen of death on my MacBook Pro, even after resetting the PRAM... :-| Amazon's return policy doesn't allow a refund, exchange or replacement after 30 days. So, if you buy this drive, get an extended warranty along with it!
customer_reviews.author: DeeSquared

customer_reviews.title: The drive is great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a drive in my macbook pro mid 2012 because I got the "no drive" logo... long story short, the drive was fine and I just needed to replace the drive cable. Oh well, I'm still keeping the drive because its better than what was in it.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis B.

customer_reviews.title: Another user recommends installing OS from option key (NOT INSTALL DVD/DISK DRIVE) and now it works just fine. Mac even updated
customer_reviews.text: Installed the drive my self, problem free for a few months then I could no longer do software updates on late 2010 MacBook Pro. Backed up data on flash drive and erased the disk. Another user recommends installing OS from option key (NOT INSTALL DVD/DISK DRIVE) and now it works just fine. Mac even updated software. Now just want to see how to install OS X El Capitan. Not that important but we shall soon see. EXCELLENT VALUE FOR DYI!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Crypto Que

customer_reviews.title: Great PS3 replacement drive
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect replacement drive for my old PS3. My son kept losing his games when the original drive started to get errors on a pretty regular basis. I did some searching online and found instructions on how to replace the drive. It was super simple. This drive was on sale during Cyber Week and I grabbed it up. PS3 works great now and seems to be a little quicker on the load screens. All in all well worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: karmacausey

customer_reviews.title: Better than a standard hdd
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 2 years and I got it as a replacement for my laptop's old hard drive, back when high capacity SSDs were still too pricey. When it comes to performance this is somewhere in between an old style hard drive and an SSD, which makes sense since it's a hybrid drive that has components of both. I did notice an improvement in performance after I installed this drive. If you don't want to go full SSD then this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: F. T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness in a small package
customer_reviews.text: So far the best mechanical laptop hard drive I've used. The hybrid side of the house usually takes a bit to catch on but on repeated open/close or uses of programs it kicks in at full speed and comes really close to SSD speeds. It also runs quieter than any other mechanical hard drive I have used (I can't almost hear it at all). The drive works on all major OS' The only gripe I have about this drive is that it runs a bit hotter than regular mechanical drives and it also uses a bit more power. Not a deal breaker at all, but indeed it is a factor for people who go cordless a lot.
customer_reviews.author: GSX16

customer_reviews.title: A shot of morphine for your computer
customer_reviews.text: Re-imaged my Windows 7 installation from a Thinkpad Ultrabay right after the mailman threw the package to my doorstep, and booted just fine on the main hard drive caddy. However, it did slice several seconds off from hibernation, sleep and cold boot. It's a whole lot better than a regular platter-based hard drive; I was thinking of getting the WD Black series, but that'll kill my battery if I did. So, if you don't have the $500 to buy that Crucial M500 1tb SSD drive, this will work for now until you get a better deal on Black Friday. Buy this at Amazon, don't get trampled in the crowd. Peace out.
customer_reviews.author: Archie Delgado

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, I like it
customer_reviews.text: Has been working well for the past month. Definitely faster on boot-up and running the most used programs over the stock HD that came with the laptop (1TB). Primary OS is Linux (PCLOS) with Windows 10 (came with the laptop) running in virtualbox. Windows 10 loads quickly along with a couple of programs I can't run in Linux. Put the original drive in an Ext Enclosure for backups. Didn't give it 5 stars only because we'll see if it holds up. If it does then it would deserve the 5 stars. Seems like a nice compromise for the $ over a 1TB SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma C.

customer_reviews.title: A complete and total piece of crap. Died after exactly 2 months
customer_reviews.text: What more is there to say after the review title? Dead after 2 months! Really??!! I've had hard drives die before. It happens after a few years. But never so quickly or so "hard". This one is SO dead that when I (and then Apple repair shop) plugged in an external drives to diagnose using Apple Disk Utility, the Seagate crashed the disk utility too! I had heard bad things about Seagate drive before, but this confirms the rumors. It is within the 90 days warranty, so Seagate should send me a new one, but why would I want another piece of s*** like this
customer_reviews.author: The Seabrooks

customer_reviews.title: Everything is working perfectly fine until this morning my Macbook just hang
customer_reviews.text: I bought this HD back in August 16, 2015. Everything is working perfectly fine until this morning my Macbook just hang. When I rebooted my macbook, it just showed a white screen. It was not booting. I immediately thought that my HD crashed so I replaced it with my old HITACHI HD which is the original HD that came with my Macbook. Guess what happened? It booted without any issue. Now, I need a replacement from Seagate as this HD is still under warranty and only 6mos old. I'm totally an unhappy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Medina

customer_reviews.title: Straight into a PS4
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought me a PS4 at Christmas time 2014 and I bought this and installed it before turning on the PS4 for the first time. I made a really good choice. I'd say it cuts atleast 10 percent off load times and had roughly twice as much space as the stock HD. However I think I paid 10 bucks less then the current asking price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason V

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded on Dell laptop with AMD A8 vintage 2013
customer_reviews.text: Likes 1) it replaced the original stock hard drive on my Dell AMD A8 laptop. Definitely faster . Many describe the 100 percent disk utilization. Saw the same at first until I realized Windows 10 after months of not powering thru upgrade installs on the old drive tried to install them all at once. Installing this thing was like turning on a switch the laptop works again!. Just install it and leave the laptop running for 12 hours or so. This was a 2013 Dell Christmas deal from QVC GAVE THE LAPTOP LONGER USEFUL LIFE. Dislikes: So far so good hoping this drive lasts a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Curcio

customer_reviews.title: Great taste
customer_reviews.text: Ran out of space on my ps and this did the job, was very easy to hook up and get to use. I should've just got the 4tb but this has served me very well. Highly recommend to free up space and to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for an older Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for an old-school MacBook Pro HDD when it's getting old or your data storage needs have increased. I have a 2010 MacBook Pro with 250 GB and 2011 MacBook Pro with 320 GB. Both of them got this new hybrid drive. Super-easy install. Do a good backup with TimeMachine or SuperDuper or the like, and use Migration Assistant to recreate your old setup. Set aside a couple of hours to do this backup and restore. Ideally do it before you go to bed or when you leave for work. You'll have what feels like a brand-new computer.
customer_reviews.author: Western Electric

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Failed after 1 year. Was a “refurbished” HDD but expected it to last longer than that. Thankfully I created an image to reimage a new one I purchased to replace it. Recommend just buying a new one that comes with the seagate warranty. I’m a computer tech and didn’t do/expose the HDD or laptop to ANYTHING that would damage or cause the disk to fail.
customer_reviews.author: BBBBB

customer_reviews.title: Easy MacBook Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I started using my MacBook as a music server for my Sonos transport and was running out of hard disc space after ripping about 500 CDs. Rather than buying a new computer, I thought I would try a installing a new hard disc (although I have very limited experience working on computers)and elected to try this product. The install was simple and when combined with a 8 gigabyte RAM upgrade really improved the MacBook's performance. Note: If doing this install on a polycarbonate body MacBook be sure to check the instructions on the MacBook Pro installation. My plain MacBook was actually a MacBook Pro on the inside and the layout is markedly different.
customer_reviews.author: BTNMD

customer_reviews.title: Great hybrid internal HD for my MacBook Pro!
customer_reviews.text: I was running out of space on my 2011 Macbook Pro which came with 320GB HD, I installed 8GB Memory and I was looking for larger HD with quick Response, I looked at Solid state HD's and i Saw 300 GB and was priced at 300$ and higher. And i saw this 1TB Drive which was under $100.00 I installed and my computer runs at twice the speed compared to my older Drive. I am running Mac OSX Snow leopard with around 900 App's on 1 Partition, OSX 10.9.2 Mavericks on 2nd Partition and so far Installed some app's and some games and this Drive has no Issues and runs like charm. I would say this was good investment.
customer_reviews.author: H. Kamdar

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: I needed to add storage to my laptop, but didn't want to pay for full ssd. This was a great option. The hybrid of spinning disk and flash offered great perfomance boost at a budget price.
customer_reviews.author: Don J

customer_reviews.title: Put thus in my ps4
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect price for what I'm using it for. I Started running out of memory fairly quick. Especially since games can range from 25gb to 60gb maybe more. I Was gonna go with an ssd but I thought it was over kill. 500 bucks for a 400 console? 70 bucks sounds way better and the performance on the ps4 with both hard drive isn't a big difference. My neighbor installed the ssd on his and we only see a 2-4 second difference. So if your looking to upgrade your hard drive and not hurt your wallet then stick with Seagate 1TB SOLID STATE HYBRID DRIVE .
customer_reviews.author: Omar T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Drive. Excellent Warranty.
customer_reviews.text: This drive, ST500LM000, is listed on Seagate's Data Sheet as a "Laptop Thin SSHD." · It is 7mm thick. Bear this in mind for where you plan to install it. Be sure it will fit. If it does not, Seagate does have 5mm thick drives available. · It is a hybrid drive. In practical terms, that means that if this drive is used as a boot drive, the boot times and loading times for frequently-used programs will be faster. · 64MB cache. Right now, I own three drives like this. I use them as external data drives. They are very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: perstare

customer_reviews.title: Nice responsive SSHD
customer_reviews.text: I needed a little upgrade and boost to my Dell Studio 1735 laptop and this fit the bill very well. It decreased my boot time to about 15 seconds. All in all a nice upgrade. May 17 update the drive died! In my laptop today nuthin. Luckily I had a back up data and kept my cloned drive. I've RMA'ed it thru Seagate. It isn't the 1st time nor will it be the last that I've had to RMA a drive. I'll take off 2 stars until I get the replacement and reinstall it...We'll see if it last. ' Replacement drive is working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive for PS4!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my PS4 and it has given me no troubles whatsoever. Aside from the increased space, there is no appreciable difference in performance to the layman. I haven't tested it specifically for performance (watching games load, etc) but at first glance, it's not a huge performance gain if any gain at all, and by no means is it slower than the original drive, so this worked out perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Packaged securely
customer_reviews.text: My PS4 hard drive started giving out on me constantly multiple times a day I was rebuilding the database. This SSHD was perfectly suited to replace my old one and I have not had to rebuild or anything software related fixes to my PS4 since the swap. Completely awesome experience, packaged safely and securely.
customer_reviews.author: sebas

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement drive for MacBook
customer_reviews.text: I have a MacBook Pro 13" and my stock hard drive filled up. I researched Amazon reviews as well as you tube and decided on this drive. I purchased Seagate because I have always been happy with their product. This drive has performed wonderfully in my Apple for a year now and I would strongly recommend it to anyone looking to upgrade. Installation was a breeze. If you have the correct tools (I purchased the apple tool kit at the same time from Amazon) you can be done in 15 minutes. It takes more time to backup and reinstall data than it does to change the drive out.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: A welcome upgrade - PS4 seems more responsive, thumbnails create faster.  Wish I had the budget for the higher NAND version.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my PS4 - upgraded from a 500GB. In hindsight, I probably should have gotten 2TB but I had 60+$ of reward money and figured why not. I don't own many games, now with everything installed I'm at 860GB - which is really all I wanted. The PS4 seems more responsive/makes thumbnails faster - when you only have 20 or so GB free it seems to slow things down, just like a computer will run w/ an OS drive that has ~5% or less space free.
customer_reviews.author: coscreview

customer_reviews.title: I bought this drive recently. My Plan was to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive recently. My Plan was to copy my current approx 500GB notebook's drive to this, and upgrade from Windows 7 to Windows 10 with the free upgrade. So, I copied the driver to this one, and installed this drive into my laptop. I rebooted, and it took a really long time to come up. I never could get an acceptable boot time, so I wound up putting the original drive back into the system. Not sure what I will use this piece of junk for, it is very slow, wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Booker

customer_reviews.title: great drives for the money, and great upgrade idea
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic performance, especially when coming up from a 5400 rpm standard sata drive. On my laptop, it took a few minutes, and then maybe 30 minutes total, over a couple of sessions, while it "learned" its hybrid caching roles. It isn't an SSD, but more like having a 10k sas or something. increased to 1TB as well, solving a potential future issue as well. This is a synth / DAW / MIDI laptop, so is perfectly suited to the tasks at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Berry

customer_reviews.title: Seagate 500GB SSHD SATA 8GB NAND SATA - any help would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.text: Still trying to get it to work. Tried different enclosures. Same problem. I can save and retrieve files from the drive. However, when it's plugged into two different laptops and one tablet via USB - the laptops and tablet lose Wi Fi connectivity. No other drive does this - even when placed in the same enclosures. Baffled. So, the drive mostly works; but affects other computer functions for some reason. Any ideas why this would be occurring?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've had this drive for 7 months and it has ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive for 7 months and it has failed 6 times, causing the computer to crash and shut down. Five out of the 6 times I simply restarted the computer with no visible impact. The last time required me to insert a rescue disc to restart the machine. I can take a hint. I replaced it, cloning the new drive.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Kugel

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not best
customer_reviews.text: Reviewing old model: good for storage, but its slow for boot. Use a ssd for that. Few years later im having trouble booting into it, will be buying an ssd soon before it completely fails.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Speed up your older laptop for less money.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to speed up a 5 year old Gateway laptop. It works OK, but I will probably replace it later when the price of SSDs drops. It was easy to clone my old drive to the new one (used a double docking bay), and it booted right up and worked perfectly. This is not my first Seagate hybrid drive. I have installed 3 of them, 1 desktop, and 2 laptop drives. All are performing perfectly (3 years, 2 years, and new one 2 months). With SSDs hitting the market, hybrid drives give you max bang for the buck. One star off because I expected SSD speeds (no biggie) and didn't quite get them.
customer_reviews.author: 1busydad

customer_reviews.title: Great for laptop upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze once I figured out the process. Since this was a replacement hard drive for my laptop to increase file storage capacity, it was fairly smooth, and I managed to find freeware so didn't have to purchase anything additional except a hard drive enclosure and a torq driver (Caution: not all disk cloning software is the same! Some only copy the visible data, not the hidden files). Feel like I have a new machine, and not longer have to worry about clearing files off every other day.
customer_reviews.author: i-sore

customer_reviews.title: Yes, you can increase performance of your Late-2012 Mac Mini
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these SSHDs for my Late-2012 Mac Mini, which I intended to use as a server. Installation of the SSHDs was fairly painless, though time-consuming. The drives, however, perform extremely well. It used to take my Mac Mini approximately 90 seconds to boot. Now it's 27 seconds flat. And logging into the user account is pretty snappy too, depending upon how many things you have start up. Loading applications is definitely faster, though not as fast as a solid state drive or internal flash storage. In reality, you can't beat the price of these drives for the increase in performance. I may order more and put them in USB3 hard drive enclosures for extra storage space! Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and flawless performance
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive was incredibly easy to install on my mid-2010 Macbook Pro. I have had no issues so far (after a few months of use). This was an inexpensive solution to my storage limitations. I also recommend upgrading the RAM if you are experiencing some performance issues with your Macbook. I installed the Crucial 8GB Kit (4GB x 2) DDR3 at the same time I replaced my hard drive. Now, my 4-year-old Macbook Pro runs like it did the day I got it. These two products saved me a lot of money, as I initially thought I would have to buy a new computer for more storage and better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Trey M.

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Easy replacement even for a MacBook Pro, cloned my old disk with an USB adapter, switched disks, and back in production. I was thinking on a clean install, but it was not necessary, since the improvement in speed was already apparent and everything worked fine. Able to bring back my 200GB music library into the HD, and the price is really a bargain. No problem in the 2 months since I purchase this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid performance
customer_reviews.text: Working like a charm ever since i installed into my ps3 i have had so much space and no issues. Granted it does freeze sometime and has to restore but i think that comes with the territory of either the game your playing for exaple mass effect 3 game froze like it was winter all year long or having so much data like me. But can go wrong with this one its gonna hold me down for a long time will probably grab another for my ps4 when i pick that up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hard Drive At A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this hard drive to replace the hard drive in my Macbook Pro early 2011 version. I wanted something that would boot-up quickly and have some good storage capacity. This was easy to install and loaded my OS with no issues. It does boot up about 40% quicker than my older hard drive and I'm very happy with it's performance to date. I partitioned the hard drive and loaded Windows 7 on Bootcamp and now have the best of both worlds! I would recommend this hard drive to anyone looking to bring new life to an older laptop! Two thumbs up!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dewpoint Reviews

customer_reviews.title: PS4 Replacement Drive
customer_reviews.text: This works great in my PS4. Makes the most sense to upgrade to this for speed rather than going with an HDD w/ 7400 RPM's as i have read that those can cause heat issues. Be forewarned that if you are putting this in a PS4 that you download the system software that is about 750 MBs and not the one that is around 200 MBs. The 200 MB one is the update patch and not the full system software. This caused me some headaches for a few hours. I decided I was brain dead from too much turkey and beer. Highly recommend if you are using this to upgrade your PS4.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great combination of storage capacity and speed
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've installed one of the Hybrid drives, and color me impressed. I installed it in a DELL Latitude E6500, and I put on a fresh install of Windows 7. After getting all of the updates, I started opening and closing the Chrome browser ( my favorite) and shutting down and starting up the laptop. On every reboot, I noticed that the startup time was shorter and shorter. Opening the browser became almost instantaneous. I'm sure this will improve the longer the laptop is used, as the most used files are moved to the SSD portion of the drive. Anyone wanting a large capacity hard drive with near SSD performance levels should consider this drive!
customer_reviews.author: Barry M. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good hard drive
customer_reviews.text: My old hard drive died a few months ago, I went to see if could be fixed, and I left the caddy at the repair place where it got lost because it really was dead. After a little while, I decided to get a new one, and this one was awesome, but I was screwed cuz laptops make caddies, not hard drives :/ I ended up getting an extra caddy, bending stuff of so it stays in place and taking it down so it stays even better, but still there are a few quirky parts, so still not perfect. I guess the lesson is if you replace the hard drive, then HOLD ONTO THE CADDY!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew DiMasi

customer_reviews.title: I just installed this in my macbook pro mid 2009 ...
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this in my macbook pro mid 2009 and works very well. Boot time and Loading up photos were faster. Very quiet SSHD. I used time machine to backup the old HDD onto an external, installed the new drive, hold command + R while the computer is booting up, used the HDD utility to partitioned the new HDD then restore from the external drive.
customer_reviews.author: LN777

customer_reviews.title: breathed new life into 3 year old Dell laptop, came at a very good price.
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet, fast hard drive. This replaced a 7200 RPM Hitachi 500 GB hard drive that faltered and failed after 3 years. Very noticeably the Dell laptop cooling fan is not running as often as it used to with the Hitachi drive. I presume the laptop is running cooler because this is a newer "slim" case and because it spins at only 5400 RPM, uses less power. Besides the benefit of SSD hybrid, this new drive also has more memory so has to run less often - perhaps. Whatever, I am happy with this new drive. It has breathed new life into my laptop at came at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper from NY

customer_reviews.title: Great solution without thee SSD expense
customer_reviews.text: I was very please to find this runs faster after many tweaks on Windows 8.1 Pro, Fedora Linux and Linux Mint. be sure to upgrade the firmware if there is a newer one. I have found after about 5 reboots, the boot time is about as good as it can be. When you do updates or many more large files it takes a few reboots for it to improve boot speed again. With SSD coming down in price and technology changing, the hybrid solution is a great stand in. It is not as fast as an SSD, but it is a lot faster than a normal hard disk
customer_reviews.author: uaflyer

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I installed it to replace my old one in a macbook pro 15" mid-2010 and everything works perfectly. Installation was easy, disk was immediately recognized at first boot. Re-installation of OS X 10.9.5. went perfectly well on it, didn't face any issue. Disk sounds way more quiet that my previous one. I didn't check the exact boot-up time but it is definitively faster than my old one. Writing speed and accessing files is also faster but again I didn't benchmark it, it is just my impression. Overall, it is a great product, as usual with seagate. I will update my review after 6-12 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rémy G.

customer_reviews.title: Got 2 BOTH went bad in 60 days
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 BOTH went bad in 60 days. Samsung support stood behind product, returned the both for repair, but was kind of a pain thus why the 3 score. How is it possible you get 2 drives and they both corrupted the data...Still love samsung products. Expected better support, more frustration free, i only had the drives for 40 days.
customer_reviews.author: SimpleSimon

customer_reviews.title: But once you load in the OS the PS4 works fine!! There are You Tube videos showing how ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade the 500 GB hard drive in my brand new PS4. The PHYSICAL change only took a few minutes. Make sure you download the operating system from the Playstation website. That takes a while if you use a USB 2.0 flash drive. (Well over an hour). But once you load in the OS the PS4 works fine!! There are You Tube videos showing how to change out the hard drive on the PS4. Highly recommend you get this as the 500 GB hard drive is actually smaller due to the OS taking up part of the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Devout Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive!
customer_reviews.text: I put it inside my MacBook Pro (13-inch, Early 2011), and now it rocks! When I had to wait for 3 minutes before, now it starts in less than a minute. Daily applications launch are fast. This is really the perfect add to upgrade your old Macbook to work fine with Yosemite. I did the transfer through the start option, format the new drive, then image disk my ex 500Gb to this one. Reboot, tadah! Great hard drive!
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and good operation.
customer_reviews.text: I know that time will tell when upgrading something like a hard drive but I bought two of these to upgrade my wonderful laptop which I cannot replace because no one makes one like it anymore. So I chose these hybrids fo fill the gap between now and when the unit needs to finally be replaced. They are way faster and way larger in capacity and this is what I needed because I am a photographer and need more speed to handle increasingly larger shot file sizes and now when shooting hi-def video and editing all of it with increasingly more sophisticated programs. They have been in there about a month and so far they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Logan

customer_reviews.title: and it runs pretty smooth for a sshd but for 10 more bucks ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a royal pain in my rear end to get to work right! I had to format the drive twice in order to get windows seven to even see the drive. To be honest, not worth the trouble. The drive still works, and it runs pretty smooth for a sshd but for 10 more bucks I can get a black drive of the same size at Microcenter which runs faster then these dudes do. Also, can we please have a 16 gig SSD cache for these drives in the future please? Not an 8 gig cache, Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

product_meta.title: (Old Model) Seagate 500GB Gaming SSHD Sata 8GB NAND Sata 6Gb/s 2.5-Inch Internal Bare Drive (ST500LM000)
product_meta.description: Capacity:500GB| Style:8GB NANDGet the Seagate solid state hybrid drive and supercharge your laptop. SSHD combines the blazing performance of a solid state drive and the huge capacity of a hard disk, all with a budget-friendly price-tag. The Seagate SSHD is compatible with virtually any laptop computer, any OS, and any application, so you get plug-and-play, revved-up performance from any system.
feature_bullets: Solid State Hybrid Drive, boots and performs like an SSD
Thinner 7 millimeter drive for mobile devices
5x faster than traditional 7200 RPM HDD; Ideal for gaming and performance laptop
Easy Playstation upgrade up to 500GB capacity without void warranty
64MB Cache with 8GB NAND Flash for more speed, cost efficient; Now with a 5 year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,045 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
